definition: big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
medium/intermediary/matchmaker/go-between/abbr. for 媒體|媒体[mei2 ti3], media, esp. news media

sentences.english: Big Media, in any event, treated the news as a lecture.
sentences.chinese: 大媒霸把对任何事件的报道都当作是在讲课。

definition: to act as go-between (between prospective marriage partners etc)
to act as go-between (between prospective marriage partners etc)
parents of one's daughter-in-law or son-in-law/relatives by marriage
to bring together/to mediate/to arrange a deal
to send the betrothal gifts/(fig.) to conclude a marriage
to send/to assign/to appoint/servants of an official/official messenger
official post/billet/commission/CL:件[jian4]/see also 差事[chai1 shi5]
